intro: Barnadesia lehmannii var. ciliata, commonly known as the ciliated barnadesia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and wetlands. Its leaves are often covered with fine, ciliate hairs, giving it its specific variety name. The flowers are clustered in inflorescences and attract various pollinators, contributing to its ecological significance.
